title: 10-2-17 Kristi Coupe,Sherri Noel, Audrey Wright & Andrea Tsang Jackson Chat with Pat on Pat Sloan's Talk show for American Patchwork and Quilting Radio
description:
As I travel the country I’m always on the lookout for Barn quilts. When I saw Kristi Coupe’s barn quilts at Put a Quilt on it, I knew I had to have one! She is creating wonderful barn quilts for the quilters of today to use outside and inside their homes. I can wait for you to meet her and learn about her passion for barn quilts
https://putaquiltonit.com/
-----------------
Sherri Noel of RebeccaMae Designs creates colorful quilts. She is known for her block of the month quilts and I love her style. She is going to give us tips on how she pulls fabric for her signature Scrap quilts.
http://www.rebeccamaedesigns.com
---------------------
Audrey Wright has been in the quilting industry for years, starting with a shop, and working for fabric companies and in the last several years has been a pattern and fabric designer with her website Legacy Pattern. Audrey is the designer of the ‘Potato Bag’ pattern that so many of you love! I’m excited total about quilting, how it’s evolved.
http://www.makingalegacy.com/
------------------
When I saw an article about Andrea Tsang Jackson’s artist residency at the Canadian Museum of Immigration at Pier 21, I was intrigued. I loved learning more about her quilt making as I watched her posts about this incredible experience she had of working in the museum and meeting all kinds of people to hear their stories. I was delighted she is here today to chat with me!
http://3rdstoryworkshop.com/
---------------

Visit host Pat Sloan at http://www.patsloan.com
